function Person(name, age) {  this.name = name;  this.age = age; }  const person1= new Person("Lily", 19);  person1.__proto__ === Person.prototype//true person1.__proto__.__proto__ === Object.prototype//true person1.prototype === undefined  åŸå‹å¯¹è±¡ä¹Ÿå¯èƒ½æ‹¥æœ‰åŸå‹ï¼Œå¹¶ä»ä¸­ç»§æ‰¿æ–¹æ³•å’Œå±æ€§ï¼Œä¸€å±‚ä¸€å±‚ã€ä»¥æ­¤ç±»æ¨ã€‚

let myArray = ['a', 'b', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'e', 'e', 'c', 'd', 'd', 'd', 'd'] let myArrayWithNoDuplicates = myArray.reduce( (previousValue, currentValue) => {  if (previousValue.indexOf(currentValue) === -1) {  previousValue.push(currentValue)  }  return previousValue }, []) console.log(myArrayWithNoDuplicates) //outputï¼š[ 'a', 'b', 'c', 'e', 'd' ] 2ã€åˆ©ç”¨ Set()  ä¸­å…ƒç´ æ˜¯å”¯ä¸€çš„ç‰¹ç‚¹
arrayWithNoDuplicates = Array.from(new Set(myArray)) console.log(arrayWithNoDuplicates) //outputï¼š[ 'a', 'b', 'c', 'e', 'd' ] console.log([...new Set(myArray)]) //outputï¼š[ 'a', 'b', 'c', 'e', 'd' ]
